Last Week

Ben Hutton

  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - 📢Want to write modern @jsonschema in @code?📢 👇Respond to this issue with an upvote👇 https://t.co/RRXgNIBXyU The issue is in the backlog, but that doesn't mean it has any priorty, and isn't scheduled work. Let's see if we can change that!?
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - The Pull Request I've created will introduce the same warning for any JOSN document which identifies as using the 2020-12 dialect (JSON Schema draft 2020-12). https://t.co/KQmxPnNz4R It's unexciting, but could potentially save a lot of false assurance and debugging time! 🥳
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - I believe this is because VSCode is retreiving the 2020-12 meta-schema, and treating it as a normal JSON Schema, defaulting to the implementations most current dialect for validation processing.
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - In JSON Schema, unknown keywords are ignored. I explain in an issue I created today, a JSON Schema file which uses the 2020-12 dialect URI in @code will be creating a false positive in terms of validation. It will NEVER show any validation errors. https://t.co/qmSNRqu2nZ https://t.co/WTwMAoN5NR
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - This was added some two years ago: https://t.co/5LOYf9xGoS I made a PR to fix the error message around the same time: https://t.co/ukrJma2ZsZ But, right now, there's no such warning for draft 2020-12, so what's happening?
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - You might notice that in the previous images, JSON Schema draft-07 was used. This is the latest version of JSON Schema @code supports. When someone tries to use draft 2019-09, they get a warning against the `$schema` value, stating that it's not supported. https://t.co/TdlZiulVTw
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - ...you get autocomplete and validation. This is pretty neat for authoring JSON Schemas. It's also automatically applied to files at specific locations using https://t.co/fLlcUqSAZ8 It stops you making potentially silly mistakes. This is the only way I write JSON Schema documents https://t.co/5skcLQZ0gm
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - In a recent post, someone asked about Visual Studio support for newer versions of JSON Schema. A later comment included the quote in the first part of this thread (https://t.co/hlrE2MfwTQ) In VSCode, if the file type processing is JSON, and the root object includes `$schema`...
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - Drafts? JSON Schema is released as "drafts" from version 1-7, then proceeding with 2019-09 and 2020-12. @code? VSCode allows for validation of JSON Schema baked in. That's the mechansium through which you get autocomplete/intelisense AND validation in your config files 😎
  • Fri, Nov 12, 2021 - 🧐"@code is properly able to use JSON Schemas based on the 2020-12 draft." 😬 I'm afraid that would be a false positive. 🔀 I've made a PR to hopefully avoid this in the near future!) 👇 Let me explain...🧵
  • Thu, Nov 11, 2021 - 🤔 Need to make API requests which always return a specific status code? 😃 Covered! https://t.co/qQtmL04Ft9 Even 418 😉
  • Thu, Nov 11, 2021 - 😎Are you using @jsonschema in production? 🤩Want to chat about it and share the recording with the community? Just let me know! 🤙 I'm looking to record several over the next month 🥳
  • Tue, Nov 09, 2021 - @johnconnolly @darrel_miller I suspect it's possible, but I've not seen anyone write the tooling. We're trying to standardise how JSON Schema can be used for form generation. This should help library maintainers update to support newer versions, then you just have to extract schemas from your OAS doc!
  • Mon, Nov 08, 2021 - @kaa_a_zu In @code, start by setting the "language mode" to "JSON", then start your schema object with $schema with the version you want to use. Then you will have autocomplete for JSON Schema keywords.
  • Fri, Nov 05, 2021 - About 6 years ago I created a Perl library to allow @jsonschema implementations to easily use the official test suite. Today, I'm mering a PR to the JSON Schema website to list a new Perl implementation... and it uses this library! The code lives on!
